ci_support_linux_64_r_base4.4.yaml:
channel_sources:
- conda-forge
channel_targets:
- conda-forge main
cran_mirror:
- https://cran.r-project.org
docker_image:
- quay.io/condaforge/linux-anvil-x86_64:alma9
pin_run_as_build:
  r-base:
    min_pin: x.x
    max_pin: x.x
r_base:
- '4.4'
target_platform:
- linux-64

about.summary: ROC graphs, sensitivity/specificity curves, lift charts, and precision/recall plots are popular examples of trade-off visualizations for specific pairs of performance measures. ROCR is a flexible tool for creating cutoff-parameterized 2D performance curves by freely combining two from over 25 performance measures (new performance measures can be added using a standard interface). Curves from different cross-validation or bootstrapping runs can be averaged by different methods, and standard deviations, standard errors or box plots can be used to visualize the variability across the runs. The parameterization can be visualized by printing cutoff values at the corresponding curve positions, or by coloring the curve according to cutoff. All components of a performance plot can be quickly adjusted using a flexible parameter dispatching mechanism. Despite its flexibility, ROCR is easy to use, with only three commands and reasonable default values for all optional parameters.

name: r-rocr

about.summary: ROC graphs, sensitivity/specificity curves, lift charts, and precision/recall plots are popular examples of trade-off visualizations for specific pairs of performance measures. raw_meta_yaml:
{% set version = "1.0-12" %}
{% set posix = 'm2-' if win else '' %}

package:
  name: r-rocr
  version: {{ version|replace("-", "_") }}

source:
  url:
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/ROCR_{{ version }}.tar.gz
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/Archive/ROCR/ROCR_{{ version }}.tar.gz
  sha256: 21903bd977e2cf6382f016bbef3d14b5a77305b9d0dc2041b0f26a76938c95fb

build:
  skip: true  # [r_base == '3.5.1']
  number: 0
  rpaths:
    - lib/R/lib/
    - lib/

requirements:
  build:
    - cross-r-base {{ r_base }}  # [build_platform != target_platform]
    - r-gplots                   # [build_platform != target_platform]
    - {{ posix }}zip               # [win]
  host:
    - r-base
    - r-gplots
  run:
    - r-base
    - r-gplots

test:
  commands:
    - $R -e "library('ROCR')"           # [not win]
    - "\"%R%\" -e \"library('ROCR')\""  # [win]

about:
  home: http://rocr.bioinf.mpi-sb.mpg.de/
  license: GPL-2.0-or-later
  summary: ROC graphs, sensitivity/specificity curves, lift charts, and precision/recall plots are popular examples of trade-off visualizations for specific pairs of performance measures. ROCR is a flexible tool for creating cutoff-parameterized 2D performance curves by freely combining two from over 25 performance measures
    (new performance measures can be added using a standard interface). Curves from different cross-validation or bootstrapping runs can be averaged by different methods, and standard deviations, standard errors or box plots can be used to visualize the variability across the runs. The parameterization can be visualized
    by printing cutoff values at the corresponding curve positions, or by coloring the curve according to cutoff. All components of a performance plot can be quickly adjusted using a flexible parameter dispatching mechanism. Despite its flexibility, ROCR is easy to use, with only three commands and reasonable default values
    for all optional parameters.
  license_family: GPL3
  license_file: {{ environ["PREFIX"] }}/lib/R/share/licenses/GPL-3

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - conda-forge/r
